phrases: I just could not be alone.
So, what do you intend to do now?
I am thinking of going back to the village where I was born.
But, what about the Jones boy?
Kelly was worried about you and that boy until the very end.
She asked me to look after you.
It was rare for that old lady to ask something of me so humbly...
As you can see, I do not really have the means to employ a maid.
Nor do I know anyone who can, on such short notice...
If only Kelly were still alive...
If I keep that up, the old lady will not be able to rest in peace.
If I keep that up, the old lady will not be able to rest in peace.
I believe it is for the best.
And then, Master William, without a care for who saw him, held her like this!
And what is more, the girl was a maid!
So that is why he and Master Richard got into a fight!
To think they fought over a maid!
Just think, if he were to marry her, we would have to call that maid madam, eh?
Well, she might be a maid now, but what if she is a noble lady who is fallen on hard times?
But it is an utter disgrace that Master William should fall for a mere maid!
So you say, but are you sure you are not planning to find a rich husband for yourself?
You may object, but my feelings will not change.
If I cannot marry Emma, then I shall never marry!
Do you not realize how insular polite society is?
Although fortune, land and position count, the most important thing of all is...
You must be worthy of people's respect.
If not, you will be rejected.
I do not believe that marrying Emma would warrant me losing respect!
It may take some time, but I believe that people will understand in the end.
Do not go thinking you can graft a reed to an elm tree.
Elms grow in the hills, reeds by the water.
That is just the natural way of things.
If you try to bend the rules, the reeds could wither and die.
If that is the case, then l shall have to live by the water!
That really happened at the Jones' house?
Well, that ends Miss Eleanor's chances for marriage.
It is as if the whole Campbell family's been snubbed...
And here I thought the Jones' wanted a title.
Do not pay any attention to them.
It is bound to be an unfounded rumor!
Just between us gentlemen, I am rather tired of all these parties.
Already looking forward to the Epsom Derby?
Is Miss Eleanor with you today?
She is at a difficult age.
She seemed quite happy yesterday, but today she is out of sorts again.
I have not kept a close enough eye on William.
His recent behavior has been most inappropriate.
Many people behave inappropriately in their youth, it cannot really be helped.
Even so, some behavior is simply unacceptable.
I intend to hand out much stronger discipline in the future.
The poor dear, do not be too hard on him.
Please ask him to invite Eleanor out sometime.
I will inform William as such.
Someone, please stop the Young Master!
You must stop the Young Master, now!
Why did not you stop him?
The Master did not want him to leave the house!
The Young Master is not permitted to leave.
So, Stevens understands the workings of love as well.
I wish Master William to lead the life he wants as well.
Even if he does love her, it is obvious that life will always be hard for them.
I am certain the Master is only thinking of the Young Master's happiness.
Do you have some business here?
Um, do you know where Emma...?
It is not exactly a place to bring nobility...
You will have to forgive the mess.
This whole place is falling to pieces.
I was going to have lunch with Emma.
I wonder where she is gone off to?
If we wait here, she should be back soon.
I do not know much about it either.
From what Kelly told me, she was born in a little village by the sea.
She had no father, and her mother died when she was very young,
so Emma was brought up in her uncle's home.
Do not just stand there staring at nothing.
You have been off playing around!
That is all you are good at, weaseling out of work.
Children should not answer their elders back!
Before you came here, we were so much better off.
Your Uncle's soft, that is what it is.
So what if you are his sister's daughter?
That man's always been nothing but trouble.
You, take these into town and sell them.
And do not come back until you have sold them all!
She was held prisoner in that carriage for days, and then it seems she was brought to London.
She is a country girl, but she has a nice face!
She will take time to groom.
Think about it, she is a bargain!
If you are lucky, she will be the belle of the establishment.
I want someone I can use immediately.
I would be making a loss on that deal.
You took your eyes off her!
Damn it, where did she go?
I am afraid there is not much I can do.
Even a scrap of bread will do.
I have not eaten for days.
If you do something wrong, I will be the one who pays for it.
There is no end to girls like you!
If I can be of help, I will do anything.
Where is the tea for upstairs?
She has no money, poor thing.
We will be in trouble if the mistress finds out!
And she certainly will not miss one piece of bread.
Take your time, or you might choke.
This is how you make them.
You buy the flowers from Covent Garden.
If you do well, you can buy bread every night.
Emma should be home soon, I think.
Thank you very much, for all you have told me.
Next Episode: Lilies of the Valley
